channel.title: Does anyone have
channel.description: One of those netbook thingy's? Would you recommend one? ty

item.title: Does anyone have
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:15, topic:248244”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=327285.msg2570230#msg2570230 date=1228615982]

Every kid in Australia in Years 9 - 12 is getting one for school next year.
I can’t wait.

But, they’re modifying them, so it’ll probably be anti-porn, anti-msn, anti-everything.
Still, we get to keep them.

And I heard that all our schools are getting Wi-Fi.
If not, we have a McDonalds across the road that offers Wi-Fi.

They look epic.
But, I still want to get a larger, much more powerful laptop.

No, they’re only modifying the part where we can use the schools internet at home. I’m just going to reformat it.

Sweet.

What year are you in?

I’m in Year 8 currently, going into year 9.
[/quote]
Just in time for them, lucky.
I’m going into Year 11, so starting my HSC.

Do you have any more info on them? Will the specs just be like brand new ones, or are they custom made and lowered?

Either way, still a free laptop.[/quote]
As far as I know, we can do what we want on OUR internet, but when we use the school’s internet, sites will be censored. We will have full control of them, they’re brand new, and it depends what the school wants to do, they can either:

  1. Buy macbooks.
  2. Buy premade Dells.
  3. Not use the money for laptops, and not care about the students and use it to develop the school.

Read full topic

Just in time for them, lucky.

Do you have any more info on them? Will the specs just be like brand new ones, or are they custom made and lowered?

Either way, still a free laptop.

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone have
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:5, topic:248244”]maths, physics, philosophy and computing in college.

There is some specialised resolution that you can set the eeepc to which makes webpages pretty simple to read and still looks good. Another problem though is having like 12gb hard drive space.

Maths As level fucking sucks.[/quote]

Tell me about it. I do maths and further maths :p.
I got an A in both though.
This site helped me A LOT.
Like my mechanics exam i had to revise the night before because i didn’t have any other time to do it…in my mock i got like 50%(i did no work because i was concentrating on further maths) but using this site the night before in my exam i got 90%…i also had work that night so didn’t get home till 8 lol :(.
Its quite a lot of money but really worth it.
http://livemaths.co.uk
This site as well is a free online maths help forum. They respond really quick, are really friendly and intelligent.
http://www.mathhelpforum.com/math-help

Sorry to go off topic there :p.

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:7, topic:248244”]I’ve been looking at the MSI Wind and it looks like the best plus it’s cheaper than most others. MSI even provides a tool to easily overclock it to 1.8ghz

Whatever one you get, you want the 6cell battery.[/quote]

Yea the samsung nc10 comes with a 6 cell battery and everything the msi wind has…+ i think a little bit more for a little bit cheaper. :). Its been recommended as the best netbook by many sites.

The thing is embarrassingly more powerful then my Desktop computer lmao. I brought my desktop though before xp was out(and it had xp on it)…Its 40gb drive, 1.7Hgz…256mb ram…lol.

David do you run any programming related applications on it? Like if i so liked it should be fine for me to run eclipse or dream weaver if i wanted to?

Thankyou

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone have
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:3, topic:248244”]I have an eeepc 901 if you call that a netbook. Has all the functions of a normal laptop, battery life is amazing too. Very portable. I recomend it a hell of a lot if you are doing college/university work as it is so portable and easy to shove in any bag.

Check out the thread I made on it -

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Highlights

  • very cheap (£280 or so)
  • very light
  • very long battery life

only con is keyboard is a little weird to get used to, however I got used to it after a day.[/quote]

Cool thankyou.
Dont you find it a pain though on internet having to slide along to read pages because of the tiny screen?
I was planning on the new Samsung NC10 though. Its a little bigger but apparently the keyboard is perfectly fine for typing on :). Has blue tooth and that multi touch pad and stuff, along with a 160GB drive :)…although the price has just bloody gone up on it lol(only bout £30 though but still! Its christmas and there’s meant to be a tax decrease!) apparently its in extremely high demand
What course you do in college?

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone have
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I have an eeepc 901 if you call that a netbook. Has all the functions of a normal laptop, battery life is amazing too. Very portable. I recomend it a hell of a lot if you are doing college/university work as it is so portable and easy to shove in any bag.

Check out the thread I made on it -

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Highlights

  • very cheap (£280 or so)
  • very light
  • very long battery life

only con is keyboard is a little weird to get used to, however I got used to it after a day.

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone have
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Girl in my computing does, she seems to love it but it’s a little “dinky” for my liking.

Her’s came with Ubuntu installed and she put XP on it so I gave her a good telling off!

The screens are quite small, spec wise they’re fine. I’d recommend going and seeing one at a shop before buying so you get a good idea of its size.

Read full topic
